items.title: Man resembling Bondi gunman caught on Philippines CCTV in November
items.description: A man resembling Bondi gunman Naveed Akram has been captured on CCTV in Davao City in mid-November, as authorities continue to investigate the movements of him and his father, Sajid Akram, in the lead-up to the attack.

items.title: An emotional display of unity — the Bondi paddle-out in pictures
items.description: Thousands of locals packed the Bondi beachfront for an emotional paddle-out in honour of the victims of Sunday's terror attack.

items.title: 'Heroic' pair, gifted musician, 'woman of integrity' laid to rest in Sydney
items.description: A couple hailed as "heroes in every sense of the word", a "gifted musician" and a "woman of integrity" have been farewelled in ceremonies across Sydney.

items.title: EU to lend Ukraine $160b after plan to mobilise Russian assets unravels
items.description: EU leaders agree to provide a massive interest-free loan to Ukraine to meet its military and economic needs for the next two years after failing to reach an agreement on the use of frozen Russian assets.

items.title: Ex-Neighbours star Damien Richardson sentenced over Nazi gesture
items.description: Damien Richardson agreed to a restorative justice program, which will require him to apologise to the Jewish community and attend therapy.

items.title: Travball don't lie: Travis Head has become Australia's most beloved cricketer
items.description: Travis Head, last of the larrikins, is revelling in a summer of love as another glorious Ashes century guides his team ever closer to the urn.

items.title: More photos released on eve of Epstein files deadline
items.description: US Democrats continue their drip-feed of material from sex predator Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, releasing more photos on the eve of a deadline for the full publication of the Epstein files.

items.title: Luigi Mangione's pre-trial hearing triggers long wait for a ruling
items.description: Prosecutors presented evidence from Luigi Mangione's arrest, including a suspected murder weapon, but the defence wants these items excluded from the trial.

items.title: 'Better than anything Russia has got': Australian tanks arrive in Ukraine
items.description: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

items.title: Teens sentenced over deadly brawl fuelled by Instagram group chat
items.description: A social media feud between teenage girls in Wollongong in 2023 erupted into a deadly street fight, leaving Kristie McBride dead and several teens now sentenced for her manslaughter.

items.title: Family demands answers after 'disturbing' arrest captured on camera
items.description: An Aboriginal man who was known by NSW Police to have mental health issues was hospitalised after his arrest over a traffic stop.

items.title: Famine ends in Gaza but catastrophic conditions remain, global agency says
items.description: A report by the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification is still warning that over 100,000 children face malnutrition over the coming months.

items.title: Object that smashed windscreen unlikely to be anything 'from space'
items.description: Scientists were hoping an object that smashed the windscreen of a self-driving car in October was a meteorite, but SA Museum's investigation says it remains a mystery.

items.title: Search suspended for missing deep-sea diver
items.description: A professional deep-sea diver, with several fish species named in his honour, is remembered as a loving father and well-respected in the science community for his contributions to the study of fish species.

items.title: Victorian premier's husband caught drink driving
items.description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has apologised after her husband was caught drink driving, saying the incident left her "disappointed and embarrassed".

items.title: Farmers, emergency services save homestead in fatal fires in WA's south
items.description: Following fatal fires in Western Australia's south earlier this week, stories are emerging of how homes were saved and communities rallied in the wake of tragedy.

items.title: ANZ to pay $250m penalty, ASX finishes slightly up — as it happened
items.description: The Federal Court has increased penalties to be paid by ANZ to $250 million, while the ASX closed slightly higher.

items.title: Marlinyu Ghoorlie celebrates recognition as traditional owners
items.description: The result comes eight years after the native title claimant group first registered for native title, with a counterclaim by another group dismissed.

items.title: 'Degenerate monster' jailed for 24 years over DV murder of ex-partner
items.description: The stepfather of Tatiana Dokhotaru, killed by her ex-partner Danny Zayat, tells a court of her remarkable courage as Zayat is jailed for 24 years.

items.title: This robot is designed to do your chores, but would you trust it?
items.description: Humanoid robots may be part of our future, but human psychology and the uncanny valley may stand between them and world domination.

items.title: Multiple fire trucks broke down during emergency level blaze in Victoria
items.description: A Country Fire Authority crew was forced to call for help after their tanker broke down while fighting an emergency level blaze near Benalla.

items.title: Brown University shooting suspect found dead, officials say
items.description: The suspect in last week's mass shooting at Brown University has been found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound, officials say.

items.title: Prince William and Princess Catherine release 2025 Christmas card
items.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new family portrait to coincide with their annual Christmas card.

items.title: History beckons for Scott after new deal
items.description: Already the longest serving coach in Geelong history, Chris Scott's new deal with the club will put him in the company of some of the AFL's greatest ever mentors.

items.title: Heartbreak as Aussie curlers miss Olympic qualifying
items.description: Australia's mixed curling team of Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt have fallen just short of qualifying for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games.
